item.title: Today’s Wordle #1614: Hints And Answer For November 19, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1614 for November 19, 2025.

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here. If you’ve missed any days, check out our Wordle Answer Archive for every past answer.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, November 19, 2025

The Wordle answer for game #1614 is going to be one of the tougher puzzles for any player. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 6 of 6 guesses. That makes it quite harder than the 4.8 guess average from November 18.

General Wordle Hints For November 19

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word is often used to describe someone defined by what they create.
  • Hint 2: You’ll see it a lot in compound terms, especially in creative fields and crafts.
  • Hint 3: It can refer to both a person and a tool, depending on the context.
  • Hint 4: It frequently appears after another word, like “film,” “trouble,” or “history.”

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1614 for November 19, 2025

Starter Words For November 19, 2025

If you want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • RAKED
  • MARKS
  • TAKER

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1614 On November 19, 2025

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: MAKER

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

What Does Today’s Wordle Answer Mean?

Maker is a noun to describe someone who manufactures or creates products.

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1613 on November 18, 2025:

Answer: OPINE

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles. Reminder, you can check out every past Wordle answer in our official archive.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1614?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on November 20 will be Wordle Game #1615.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

Need more help with other daily games? Let us know what games you’d like tips and clues for in the comments below, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: 4 Biggest GOTY Contenders That Cruelly Missed Out On The Game Awards 2025
item.content:encoded:
We approach the end of 2025, and the year has seen another ridiculous haul of great games. The Game Awards 2025 showcase will announce one winner from six glorious nominees, but we simply can’t overlook the four games that easily could’ve been included in the pool.

Awards and ceremonies are all subjective at the end of the day. Just like a review, the verdict is reached by either one person or a select panel of people. The Game Awards 2025 will congratulate its own GOTY winner, but you might have had your own favorite. Games like Hades 2 and Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 deserve their place on the nominee list.

In our opinion, some mentions go beyond the tag of being ‘honorable,’ and we’ve identified four prime candidates.

Best The Game Awards 2025 GOTY Nominees Not Included

Blue Prince

The roguelike and roguelite genres have been on fire the last few years. Games like Hades and Balatro have not only been nominated for awards, but they’ve won many of them. It feels like a bizarre oversight to have not included Blue Prince. It was the highest-rated game of the year for a while, and won over critics and fans with its unique hunt for the 46th room in an inherited house. The trick is that the house’s floors and plans reset every night.

You only have so many steps and resources to move around, and if you don’t do it in time, you start from scratch. But you uncover new items, the game opens up, more locations and secrets are discovered, and it’s a masterful roguelike. According to Metacritic, it’s the third-best new game in 2025 (discounting the Switch 2 Breath of the Wild and Tears of the Kingdom ports) with a collective score of 92/100, so why wasn’t it included?

Dispatch

A ‘Superhero workplace comedy’ sounds like a strange concept without context. It’s all the more impressive that AdHoc Studio’s new IP not only works, but Dispatch crashed onto all screens with a triumphant superhero landing. The episodic title features an all-star cast of video game voice-over royalty, streamers, and even renowned stars, including Aaron Paul and Jeffrey Wright.

The intertwining narrative changes across all eight episodes. Your decision-making skills impact the story beats—similar to the Telltale Games formula—and there are also mini-games and other QTEs to break up the conversation and plot development. It’s also fun seeing the fun and different side of superheroes, with The Boys and Watchmen springing to mind. The late addition to 2025 has been instantly revered, but did it come too late for The Game Awards 2025?

Split Fiction

Josef Fares masterminded another co-op-only classic with Split Fiction. It carries on the immaculate work of It Takes Two by placing you and a friend into the shoes of Zoe and Mio. You experience a series of mini-games and creative gameplay mechanics at breakneck speed, giving you more variety than a family-sized picnic fruit basket.

It’s meticulously crafted, it looks gorgeous, and highlights the unbelievable work that Hazelight Studios continues to produce with each new game. It Takes Two won The Game Awards GOTY category in 2021, but Split Fiction—despite being the fourth-highest-rated game of 2025, according to Metacritic, with a score of 91 based on 100 critic reviews—doesn’t even get into the final 6 games. Go figure.

Ball X Pit

It’s only fitting to finish off with a roguelite. The irresistible gameplay loop of ‘rogue’ games is none more evident than in Ball X Pit. Its curious name might confuse you, but there’s nothing ambiguous about its gameplay. Block-breaking games aren’t new, but not many try to build a full game around the concept, and to such an overt degree.

Each Ball X Pit game lasts 5-15 minutes. You move along the stage in semi-on-rails fashion, and you earn XP and power-ups as you play. Pickups give you choices, which determine your build for each run, and it leads to this great chase for OP playthroughs where you destroy enemies, crush bosses, and earn lots of resources toward your next effort. It’s been labeled as the ‘Balatro of 2025,’ and this would be doing a disservice to Ball X Pit in some ways—it’s that good!

The Game Awards 2025 is sure to be another interesting ceremony with opinions, shocks, and much post-show discussion. Do you agree with any of our GOTY nominees who missed out? Did any not make it who you think deserved a spot? Let us know through the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

You should also check out the shocking revelation that No Xbox Exclusive Has Been Nominated For GOTY Since 2010.

item.title: No Xbox Exclusive Has Been Nominated For GOTY Since 2010
item.content:encoded:
Xbox exclusives haven’t been a part of Game of the Year (GOTY) nominations since 2010, making it 15 years since one was nominated.

The latest list of nominees for The Game Awards 2025 is now live, with winners announced on December 11. However, as we wait for the award show to take place and a new GOTY to be crowned, players should know that no Xbox exclusives are making it to nominations, leaving them out of the running to win the prestigious award.

Xbox Exclusives Haven’t Been Nominated for GOTY for 15 Years

Spotted by TheGamer, Nick Marseil’s latest post on X (formerly Twitter) reveals every GOTY nominee for The Game Awards from 2013 to today, categorising them as PlayStation, Nintendo, and Xbox Exclusives. PlayStation has had 15 games nominated, including titles like The Last of Us, Marvel’s Spider-Man, God of War, Death Stranding 2, and more. Nintendo has had 12 exclusives nominated, including Super Mario Odyssey, The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom, Donkey Kong Bananza, and more. Xbox, as mentioned above, has had none.

The answer to when Xbox Exclusives were nominated for GOTY will not make the fans happy, as it was before The Game Awards ceremony even began. The last time Xbox exclusives were nominated for this award was through the Spike Video Game Awards, where Halo: Reach and Mass Effect 2 were nominated. However, none of these games won the award.

If you are wondering about the latest GOTY nominees for TGA 2025, the list includes: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, Hollow Knight: Silksong, Donkey Kong Bananza, Death Stranding 2: On The Beach, Kingdom Come Deliverance 2, and Hades 2. Additionally, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 has broken a record at TGA 2025.

What are your thoughts on no Xbox exclusives being nominated for GOTY since 2010? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Krafton CEO being accused of using ChatGPT to avoid paying $250 million bonus. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
